Detailed Description

A FilterProvider is used to access rows of a child provider which match a criterion specified in a filter rule.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef AbstractDelegationProvider FilterProvider::Base
 

Reimplemented from AbstractDelegationProvider.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

FilterProvider::FilterProvider (   ) 
 

If the default constructor is used, the parameters have to be provided by using the method Init.

FilterProvider::FilterProvider (  Provider *  provider,
FilterRule *  rule,
INT  columnid = 0,
BOOLEAN  negation = FALSE
) 
 

On construction the following parameters have to be specified: provider: The provider which should be filtered. rule: Specify how the rows are filtered. columnid: Specify on which columnid rule has to be applied. negation: Specify whether rule must be negated.

FilterProvider::~FilterProvider (   )  [virtual]
 

Destructor.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN FilterProvider::DeleteAllRows (  ProviderListener *  listener = 0  )  [virtual]
 

DeleteAllRows deletes all filtered rows of the child-provider. Returns FALSE if no child-provider was set.

BOOLEAN FilterProvider::IsRowFiltered (  Provider *  base_provider,
INT  row,
BOOLEAN  negate
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Determines whether or not the specified row should be included.

Parameters:
base_provider Child provider.
row Index of row to test.
negate TRUE to negate the result, FALSE otherwise.
Returns:
TRUE to include row row, FALSE otherwise.

void FilterProvider::OnExecutingListener (  Provider *  provider = 0  )  [virtual]
 

Called by DelegationProviderListener to modify the progress value. The current version reflects the progress value of the child-provider until 99 percent.
